intro: Silene trichocalycina, commonly known as the purple fringed catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its striking, violet-pink flowers with fringed petals. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Silene trichocalycina is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
